titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَمْ يُعَلِّمْ نَبِيَّهُ عِلْماً إِلَّا أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يُعَلِّمَهُ أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ أَنَّهُ كَانَ شَرِيكَهُ فِي الْعِلْمِ
titles.en: Chapter 49 – Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic did not Teach His<sup>azwj</sup> Prophet<sup>saww</sup> a knowledge except that He<sup>azwj</sup> Commanded him<sup>asws</sup> that he<sup>saww</sup> teach it to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was his<sup>saww</sup> associate in the knowledge

titles.ar: بَابُ جِهَاتِ عُلُومِ الْأَئِمَّةِ ( عليهم السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 50 – Aspects of the knowledges of the Imams<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) يَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ مَا كَانَ وَ مَا يَكُونُ وَ أَنَّهُ لَا يَخْفَى عَلَيْهِمُ الشَّيْ‏ءُ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمْ
titles.en: Chapter 48 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> know the knowledge of whatever has happened, and whatever will be happening, and it is so that nothing is hidden from them<sup>asws</sup>, may the Salawat of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> be upon them<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَمْ يُعَلِّمْ نَبِيَّهُ عِلْماً إِلَّا أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يُعَلِّمَهُ أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ أَنَّهُ كَانَ شَرِيكَهُ فِي الْعِلْمِ
titles.en: Chapter 49 – Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic did not Teach His<sup>azwj</sup> Prophet<sup>saww</sup> a knowledge except that He<sup>azwj</sup> Commanded him<sup>asws</sup> that he<sup>saww</sup> teach it to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was his<sup>saww</sup> associate in the knowledge

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/134)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ حُمْرَانَ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ جَبْرَئِيلَ ( عليه السلام ) أَتَى رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِرُمَّانَتَيْنِ فَأَكَلَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِحْدَاهُمَا وَ كَسَرَ الْأُخْرَى بِنِصْفَيْنِ فَأَكَلَ نِصْفاً وَ أَطْعَمَ عَلِيّاً نِصْفاً ثُمَّ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَا أَخِي هَلْ تَدْرِي مَا هَاتَانِ الرُّمَّانَتَانِ قَالَ لَا قَالَ أَمَّا الْأُولَى فَالنُّبُوَّةُ لَيْسَ لَكَ فِيهَا نَصِيبٌ وَ أَمَّا الْأُخْرَى فَالْعِلْمُ أَنْتَ شَرِيكِي فِيهِ
فَقُلْتُ أَصْلَحَكَ اللَّهُ كَيْفَ كَانَ يَكُونُ شَرِيكَهُ فِيهِ قَالَ لَمْ يُعَلِّمِ اللَّهُ مُحَمَّداً ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) عِلْماً إِلَّا وَ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يُعَلِّمَهُ عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Ibn Azina, from Abdullah Bin Suleyman, from Humran Bin Ayn,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Jibraeel<sup>as</sup> came to Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> with two pomegranates. So Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> ate one of the two and broke the other one in two halves. So he<sup>saww</sup> ate half and fed Ali<sup>asws</sup> half. Then Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘O my<sup>saww</sup> brother<sup>asws</sup>! Do you<sup>asws</sup> know what there two pomegranates are?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’. He<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘As for the first, so it is the Prophet-hood. There isn’t a share for you<sup>asws</sup> in it. And as for the other, so it is the knowledge. You<sup>asws</sup> are my<sup>saww</sup> associate in it’.

So I said, ‘May Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Keep you<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> well! He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> happened to be his<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> associate in it?’ He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> did not Teach Muhammad<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> a knowledge except that He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Commanded him<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> that he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> teaches it to Ali<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ibn ’Udhayna from ‘Abdallah ibn Sulayman from Humran ibn A‘yan from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “Once Jibril came to the Messenger of Allah and brought him two pieces of pomegranates. The Messenger of Allah ate one of them and broke the other one into two pieces. He then ate one half and fed the other half to Ali (a.s.). The Messenger of Allah said, “O my brother, do you know what those pieces of pomegranates were?” He said, “No, I do not know.” He then said, “The first one was prophet-hood. There is no share in it for you. The other one is knowledge in which you’re my partner.” I then said, “May Allah keep you well, how was that?” He would be his partner in it?” He said, “Allah did not teach any knowledge but that He commanded him to teach it to Ali (a.s.).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/135)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: نَزَلَ جَبْرَئِيلُ ( عليه السلام ) عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِرُمَّانَتَيْنِ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَأَعْطَاهُ إِيَّاهُمَا فَأَكَلَ وَاحِدَةً وَ كَسَرَ الْأُخْرَى بِنِصْفَيْنِ فَأَعْطَى عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) نِصْفَهَا فَأَكَلَهَا فَقَالَ يَا عَلِيُّ أَمَّا الرُّمَّانَةُ الْأُولَى الَّتِي أَكَلْتُهَا فَالنُّبُوَّةُ لَيْسَ لَكَ فِيهَا شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ أَمَّا الْأُخْرَى فَهُوَ الْعِلْمُ فَأَنْتَ شَرِيكِي فِيهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Azina, from Zurara,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘Jibraeel<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> descended unto Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> with two pomegranates from the Paradise. So he<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> gave him<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> these two. So he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> ate one and broke the other one into two halves, and gave Ali<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> half of it, so he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> ate it, and he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> said: ‘O Ali<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>! As for the first pomegranate which I<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> ate, so it is the Prophet-hood, there isn’t a share for you in it. And as for the other, so it is the knowledge, so You<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> are my<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> associate in it’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ibn ‘Udhaynah from Zurarah from abu Ja‘far (a.s.) who has said the following. “Once Jibril brought from Paradise two pieces of pomegranate to the Messenger of Allah and brought him two pieces of pomegranates. The Messenger of Allah ate one of them and broke the other one into two pieces. He then ate one half and gave the other half to Ali (a.s.) who also ate it (a.s.). The Messenger of Allah said, “The first one that I ate was prophet-hood. There is no share in it for you. The other one is knowledge in which you are my partner.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/135)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ يُونُسَ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ نَزَلَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِرُمَّانَتَيْنِ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَلَقِيَهُ عَلِيٌّ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ مَا هَاتَانِ الرُّمَّانَتَانِ اللَّتَانِ فِي يَدِكَ فَقَالَ أَمَّا هَذِهِ فَالنُّبُوَّةُ لَيْسَ لَكَ فِيهَا نَصِيبٌ وَ أَمَّا هَذِهِ فَالْعِلْمُ

ثُمَّ فَلَقَهَا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِنِصْفَيْنِ فَأَعْطَاهُ نِصْفَهَا وَ أَخَذَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) نِصْفَهَا ثُمَّ قَالَ أَنْتَ شَرِيكِي فِيهِ وَ أَنَا شَرِيكُكَ فِيهِ

قَالَ فَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ وَ اللَّهِ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) حَرْفاً مِمَّا عَلَّمَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَّا وَ قَدْ عَلَّمَهُ عَلِيّاً ثُمَّ انْتَهَى الْعِلْمُ إِلَيْنَا ثُمَّ وَضَعَ يَدَهُ عَلَى صَدْرِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Hameed, from Mansour Bin Yunus, from Ibn Azina, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Jibraeel<sup>as</sup> descended unto Muhammad<sup>saww</sup> with two pomegranates from the Paradise. So he<sup>as</sup> met Ali<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘What are these two pomegranates which are in your<sup>as</sup> hand?’ So he<sup>as</sup> said: ‘As for this one, so it is the Prophet-hood. There isn’t a share for you<sup>azwj</sup> in it, and as for this one, so it is the knowledge’.

Then Rasool-Allah<sup>azwj</sup> split it into two halves, and gave him<sup>asws</sup> half of it, and Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> took half of it, then said: ‘You<sup>asws</sup> are my<sup>saww</sup> associate in it, and I<sup>saww</sup> am your<sup>asws</sup> associate in it’.

He (Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>) said: ‘So he<sup>saww</sup> did not know a letter, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, from what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic had Taught him<sup>saww</sup> except and he<sup>saww</sup> had taught it to Ali<sup>azwj</sup>. Then the knowledge ended up to us<sup>asws</sup>’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> placed his<sup>asws</sup> hand upon his<sup>asws</sup> chest’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Hassan from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Hamid from Mansur ibn Yunus from ibn ’Udhaynah from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said that he heard abu Ja‘far (a.s.) say the following. “Once Jibril descended to Muhammad (s.a) (and) brought two pieces of pomegranate from Paradise. Ali (a.s.) meet him and asked, “What (kind of ) pomegranate are those in your hands?” He replied, “As to this one, it is the Prophet-hood in which there is no share for you. As to this one, it is knowledge. Then the Messenger of Allah broke it into two halves. He then gave one half and the Messenger of Allah kept the other half and then said, “You are my partner in it and I am your partner in it.” The Imam (a.s.) then said, “I swear by Allah that there was nothing of all the knowledge that was taught to the Messenger of Allah but that he taught them to Ali (a.s.) and thereafter knowledge was transferred to us. He then placed his hand over his chest.”
